radiographic_examinations.findings: Complex fluid collection measuring 2.7 x 2.8 x 4.1 cm with enhancing walls and peripheral stranding in the right lower quadrant, likely representing an abscess from perforated appendicitis. The proximal aspect of the appendix appears dilated and hyperemic. At least two vague hypodense lesions within the right lobe of the liver measuring up to 10 mm. The rest of the abdominal organs including liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and kidneys were unremarkable.
